subject: Inherit from Junit 4 while using its Annotations
msgSnippet: Hi, i m using junit (and jwebunit) for testing a webapplication. In the testframework i have serveral testcases (seperate classes) of which evereyone inherits
messageBody:
Hi, i'm using junit (and jwebunit) for testing a webapplication. In
the testframework i have serveral testcases (seperate classes) of
which evereyone inherits from another class. furthermore it is
nessecary that this class inherits from the junit-TestCase class. I am
using annotations in the test classes.

Small Example:

=========================================

import junit.framework.TestCase;

public class Junit4Test extends TestCase {

}

=========================================

import org.junit.After;
import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.BeforeClass;
import org.junit.Test;

public class Junit4TestChild extends Junit4Test {

@BeforeClass
public static void setUpBeforeClass() {
System.out.println("setUpBeforeClass");
}

@Before
public void setUp() {
System.out.println("setUp");
}

@Test
public void one() {
System.out.println("testOne");
}

@Test
public void two() {
System.out.println("testTwo");
}

@After
public void tearDown() {
System.out.println("tearDown");
}
}

No I have the problem that either (in the upper version) the method
"setUpBeforeClass" is not called or (maybe that helps for finding a
solution) if the test methods do not start with "test" (see example
below) an exception is thrown.

Example:

=========================================

import junit.framework.TestCase;

public class Junit4Test extends TestCase {

}

=========================================

import org.junit.After;
import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.BeforeClass;
import org.junit.Test;

public class Junit4TestChild extends Junit4Test {

@BeforeClass
public static void setUpBeforeClass() {
System.out.println("setUpBeforeClass");
}

@Before
public void setUp() {
System.out.println("setUp");
}

@Test
public void one() {
System.out.println("testOne");
}

@Test
public void two() {
System.out.println("testTwo");
}

@After
public void tearDown() {
System.out.println("tearDown");
}
}

Exception:

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: No tests found in
sesystest.snmp.testCases.trapHandling.Junit4TestChild

As I mentioned it is indispensable that the "upper" class (here:
Junit4Test) inherits from junit-TestCase, because of the usage of the
assert methods of junit in the tests. Is there any solution for this
behaviour/problem?

Via google I found some examples that also used junit 4 and used the
assert methods in the static way (i.e. TestCase.assertTrue(...)). Is
this the way its meant to be used? :)

thanks
